Source.Name: python-mpmath
Source.Summary: A python library for arbitrary-precision floating-point arithmetic
Source.Description: Mpmath implements a large set of mathematical functions and provides utilities for arbitrary-precision numerical differentiation, integration, root-finding, interval arithmetic, and other tasks. It supports unlimited exponent sizes, has full support for complex numbers, and is faster than Python's standard decimal library.

Update.Comment: Version bump to 0.14: New features include support for using a Cython-based backend soon to be added to Sage (giving a large speedup of mpmath in Sage), support for 3D plotting, fast low-precision functions (using Python's built-in float/complex types), an implementation of the Riemann-Siegel expansion for the Riemann zeta function, many improvements to evaluation of hypergeometric functions, miscellaneous new special functions, matrix functions, and several bugfixes and optimizations.
